body:
This is a controversial feature because there is a strong feeling by a lot of players that "the game shouldn't play itself".  Managing your production is one of the key features of the game, and is certainly one of the biggest deciders between an average/poor and a good player.

Do any other modern games (outside of AoM) include this feature?  Unless there is a precedence in other well known games (and therefore a reasonable expectation for this to exist), then I don't think we should include this feature.
IIRC Warzone 2100 also had this but it was quite a while ago I last played it. A boolean parameter in the Infos with the default being false could be an option.

I would love to see a mod featuring this "autoqueue". 
It remembers me of SupremeCommander: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2997#issuecomment-22486399
You still have to manage your queue with this, it just means less button pressing.

I have the feeling that this will again divide ppl into hardened blox of Opinionville.

If I understand it correctly, then you can set any unit on auto-queue but that would result in that production facility only producing that unit until the auto is stopped. Also true for any other unit from that same structure that is set to auto?

Because we want to make sure that you _cannot_ auto-queue unit compositions, becasue then I really have to agree with penev here ("Hjelp! My game is playing itself" - a.k.a.: "Look Ma, no hands!")

TL;DR - It would be overkill if you could auto-queue more than one unit (compositions). Also keep in mind that this would make auto-queueing unit compositions instantly possible in TD since multiple construcion facilities give you multiple queues.

I have the feeling that this would have a far greater impact on TD than on RA in bigger games.
Auto-queing only one unit is redundant to spam-shift-clicking to queue up 500 units of that type.
You can already queue/dequeue enough units using the shift key in seconds to last the entire game so I don't see how this makes the game play itself.

I guess you want this as an alternative to those situations where you are frantically removing the 56 queues of that certain unit type you issued just 2 mins ago, becasue the in-game situation has changed and you need to build something else.
Imo if thats the reason it would be better to just add a cancel all button, wasnt there a PR for that recently?

All this does is remove mindless click spamming to reach a number and not any significant thought. However, with #9595 for directly canceling and CTRL + SHIFT + left_click used to queue say 100 (or enough to last at least a long game), this can be approximated.

This is incompatible with #9595 since that uses CTRL + right_click for something else. Also, right clicking is associated with canceling and left clicking with queuing. Therefore, this should use CTRL + left_click.

Placing "PR: Changes Requested" for switching to the more orthogonal use of CTRL + left_click instead of CTRL + right_click.

I reject the arguments that thin makes the game play it self. For the exact reasons mentioned above, shift clicking to reach >100 is already common. I could use autohotkey to get this same effect. 

Lets be honest here, this only solves one problem, having to micro your build queue on broken maps, or broken units. The two units (I only play RA) that will see this, is Arty and SHOK, maybe a few others but not to the levels seen by these two. 

Why did you set units to defend by default? Why do miners do searching for gems/ore? why are there rally points for buildings. These are all the game "playing itself" except not really... if you set a bad rally point, kiss your units good bye, auto queue the wrong unit, good buy cash hello steamroller.

And just to make sure I hit every point, if you really want to go with the whole " separates better players" argument, why does every one who plays sovi spam shok inf & flak, and every one who plays allies spam arty and hinds?? Auto queue is a solution to one unit being the only one that anyone uses.
As requested, CTRL-Left click is now used to enable autoqueue.
@GrayHatter: Those points sound to me like an argument _against_ this feature, and that the balance of the RA mod should be fixed instead.

@pchote, it is, but if I come out and say that arty and SHOK are both OP, I'd get lynched. No one want's you to nerf their favorite strategy. But that's still no reason that this shouldn't exist. Even if balance issues are fixed, the only thing you're doing is reducing the number of clicks.
I assume you're talking about the current (old) release: SHOK have been heavily nerfed in the playtests/next release.
@pchote I play release more because of the performance, but even in the playtest, If I'm playing russia, I'm still spamming Shok and flak maybe some scuds MAYBE

> You can already queue/dequeue enough units using the shift key in seconds to last the entire game so I don't see how this makes the game play itself.

And you don't see that as a problem? With the mod's/map's economy, gameplay or production, unit balance?

> Lets be honest here, this only solves one problem

The thing is it doesn't solve _any_ problem (sorry @irungentoo ).
And with the argument made (by the supporters of this, no less!) that you can queue 150 units in 2 seconds anyway, I really don't see the point.
:-1: 

I could probably go with it if it is configurable (it's not even configurable!), so thirdparty mods can enable it per production queue if they want, but I'm guessing that's now what you want here, but rather want it in RA.

If we do decide to take this feature then are some UI issues that will first need to be resolved:
- Ctrl-clicking on an item that currently isn't in the queue will do nothing.
- If you ctrl-click on an item in the queue while you have multiple units queued then it will repeat the entire queue (e.g. 5 harvesters, then 5 bikes, then 5 buggies in a loop), but the UI doesn't indicate what is going on: the queued numbers stay frozen at the original numbers.  This is confusing: expected behaviour would be to have the queued number count down so you know where in the queue you are.

If we can't make this work naturally/intuitively, then I don't think we should take this for the reasons that @penev92 gave above.
The best course of action would be to discuss this in IRC and work out exactly how the interaction for this should work before rewriting it (over and over again) to save a lot of work and hassle.
Point 2 should be fixed, not sure what ctrl-clicking an item that isn't in the queue should do.
Presumably the same thing as ctrl-clicking an item that isn't in the queue.
The style fixes should be squashed away.
I think everything is good now.
Just played it, no issues. worked as I expected it to!

Just tested this on in real multiplayer game with 3 other people each using the autoqueue and it worked perfectly.

If anyone against this change hasn't tried it out, please do and you might change your mind.

The real problem, which I guess I didn't make clear enough above, is that ctrl-clicking on an icon doesn't do anything related to that icon, which is not intuitive.  Ctrl-clicking on an icon should auto-queue _that_ unit, and not just toggle the queue repeat.  Proper UX for this as-is would be to have a separate "toggle queue" button.

I believe that @r34ch's proposal in #10166 to indicate queue status on the queue icon is a more elegant solution, so on balance I am now against taking this auto-queue feature, even if the ui is improved.  Sorry.
> I believe that @r34ch's proposal in #10166 to indicate queue status on the queue icon is a much better solution to the problem, ...
@pchote, @r34ch, etc. Should the tab have some kind of overlay, 4 states ([not] selected, [not] active), or something else?

IMO, the fact alone that this is a problem _at all_, as opposed to, say, wondering whether you would even be able to _afford_ all those units, is just an indicator to me that something is already horribly wrong with either our gameplay, or the maps that people play. :-1:
Needs a rebase.
